nodes.bodyText: Why did these versions get updated?
I'm not sure. It looks like I'm using webpack v4.16.3 to build the js files. I changed the version back to 4.16 in package.json.

I think that including the unprocessed content of the details field in the pop-up is more in line with the current UI (keeping 'business logic' out of the view).  But as you pointed out, that also has drawbacks.
I agree, it fits the style better. I added a screenshot in another comment that I think is a good compromise.
Since the result should only have one row containing one column, you can use result.getOnlyValue().

Let's add a comment explaining why we're adding the test (the UI depends on the distribution type being part of the details and rendered as Distribution: <type>.  Without that context the test doesn't make much sense.
We should preserve the value coming from the server and not change capitalization.
Perhaps you can try matching against a regex and get the distribution type from a match group.
Nice.  Use a more generic regex (something like [a-zA-Z]+) to match the distribution type (no need to hard-code the possible values).  And you can inline the regex.

var distributionPattern = /Distribution:\s+(\w+)/;


var name
\w+ -- since we use enum name here, an _  or a digit could also appear here
generally, when you allow some space (\s), you either mean "exactly space" ( ), or "some amount of whitespace" (\s+)

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3393,6 +3393,23 @@ public void testLogicalExplain()
         assertEquals(getOnlyElement(result.getOnlyColumnAsSet()), getExplainPlan(query, LOGICAL));
     }
 
+    @Test
+    public void testJoinDistribution()
+    {
+        /*
+            This test makes sure that the query plan includes the distribution info for joins.
+            The webui live plan displays the distribution type for joins, and the plan details
+            need to be structured like 'Distribution: <type>' for this feature to work.
+        */

nodes.bodyText:
avoid \n as they don't slightly reduce readability, use spaces instead
also, you can make the lines a bit longer and remove unnecessary WHERE, LIMIT
then you can inline the variable:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    String query = "SELECT c.custkey\n" +
          
          
            
                                   "FROM customer c JOIN nation n\n" +
          
          
            
                                   "  ON n.nationkey = c.nationkey\n" +
          
          
            
                                   "WHERE n.name = 'UNITED STATES'\n" +
          
          
            
                                   "LIMIT 5";
          
          
            
                    MaterializedResult result = computeActual("EXPLAIN (FORMAT TEXT) " + query);
          
          
            
                    MaterializedResult result = computeActual("EXPLAIN (FORMAT TEXT) SELECT c.custkey FROM customer c JOIN nation n ON n.nationkey = c.nationkey");
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3393,6 +3393,23 @@ public void testLogicalExplain()
         assertEquals(getOnlyElement(result.getOnlyColumnAsSet()), getExplainPlan(query, LOGICAL));
     }
 
+    @Test
+    public void testJoinDistribution()
+    {
+        /*
+            This test makes sure that the query plan includes the distribution info for joins.
+            The webui live plan displays the distribution type for joins, and the plan details
+            need to be structured like 'Distribution: <type>' for this feature to work.
+        */
+        String query = "SELECT c.custkey\n" +
+                       "FROM customer c JOIN nation n\n" +
+                       "  ON n.nationkey = c.nationkey\n" +
+                       "WHERE n.name = 'UNITED STATES'\n" +
+                       "LIMIT 5";
+        MaterializedResult result = computeActual("EXPLAIN (FORMAT TEXT) " + query);

nodes.bodyText:
avoid Object#toString, it can mask problems, use cast instead:
assertThat((String) result.getOnlyValue()) ....
